result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:35 PM - case called.  Defendant Michael Arthur Harper appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Nicholas Smith appeared specially on behalf of the Defendant.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smith - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Argument by State as to bond.  Response by Atty Smith.  Court sets bond.  Attorney Smith waives the time limits for scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
